intro: Chamaesyce liukiuensis, commonly known as the Liuqiu sandwort, is a flowering plant native to the Ryukyu Islands of Japan. It is a member of the Portulacaceae family and is characterized by its small, succulent leaves and clusters of yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and thrives in coastal or maritime environments. It is often found in open, sunny habitats and is adapted to withstand salty air and wind. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
